@Johnny Depp     Hello, Mr. Depp.   I hope everything is going well for you.      In ready about Amber Heard and her ways, this reminded me of my late best friend,who often sought out women that were broken and needed reform- this was on a subconscious level,and reading about people who have C- PTSD from childhood, they try to make a bad parent good, somehow.            I wanted to pass on the fact that it's common, especially in America, nothing to be ashamed of, it's just the way the brain is structured.     There's therapy for this, and can be researched at one's convenience.    I hope that it's something you,and your siblings can do. It will be life-changing.  Stay safe out there,Mr. Depp.   P.S., in my friend's case, he found out this fact rather late in life,it explains a lot.  His mother has Plains Native ancestry,and was from the boarding school system. It crippled her ability to parent, and it's quite widespread. Abuse generates future abuse without intervention, usually.        Most won't stop without outside help.

JD, in my legal view (as a lawyer having studied UK law), firmly believe he was very badly advised to take that case in that jurisdiction. The legal team knew the law in the UK re tabloids but they advised him to sue anyway. Why? Because JD has deep pockets. he'll be destitute if he doesn't get proper legal advise FAST. I do not doubt this whole mess was caused by lawyers egging both sides on to make allegation and counter allegation. They do it all the time in day to day divorce law. If you have 5k in your bank, they will string you out for 5k and them dump you. You lose, they win and that's all they care about. A big fish like JD, they will smell all that money a hundred miles away. They will advise him to sue for defamation knowing full well that he will lose on the law but nothing will harm them. In the end it just feeds trial by media, which is an injustice so let's not engage in this, okay? Wish them a peaceful resolution and be done.
